Recipe.Instruction: Add 4 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of salt to a pot and bring to a boil.
Slowly add and stir in 1 cup of grits with a wooden spoon. It's important to stir well to prevent clumping.
Reduce the heat and let simmer. The grits are done when the desired consistency is achieved.
While the grits cook, use a pan and cook the sausage until it browns.
Drain the grease from the sausage, then add the sausage to the grits. Stir.
Stir in butter and cheese and simmer.
Serve in bowls.

Ingredient.name: chocolate chips (or chunks, or chopped chocolate)

Recipe.Instruction: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking pan with parchment paper and set aside.
In a separate bowl mix flour, baking soda, salt, baking powder. Set aside.
Cream together butter and sugars until combined.
Beat in eggs and vanilla until fluffy.
Mix in the dry ingredients until combined.
Add 12 oz package of chocolate chips and mix well.

Roll 2-3 TBS (depending on how large you like your cookies) of dough at a time into balls and place them evenly spaced on your prepared cookie sheets. (alternately, use a small cookie scoop to make your cookies).
Bake in preheated oven for approximately 8-10 minutes. Take them out when they are just barely starting to turn brown.
Let them sit on the baking pan for 2 minutes before removing to cooling rack.

Ingredient.name: beef instant ramen noodles (1 square of ramen and 1 packet of beef seasoning)

Recipe.Instruction: Place all ingredients except for the egg, sesame seeds, and noodles into a pot of water.
Stir ingredients in pot and heat it on low for 2 minutes.
Crack egg into a bowl and put sesame seeds into a bowl.
Put the square of ramen noodles into the pot and change the heat level to high.
While the noodles are cooking, beat the egg yolk in the bowl really well (sesame seeds help break up the egg yolk).
When the noodles become stringy, break them up, and dump everything from the pot into a bowl.
Stir everything in the bowl so the egg yolk is evenly distributed throughout. The yolk cooks almost instantly.
